summary: This document is a Second Amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One, executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein in 2004. It modifies the trust's distribution terms, notably deleting a bequest to Jeffrey A. Schantz and redirecting $20 million to the trustees of a related trust. The amendment is notarized by Lauren J. Kwintner.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: He is the grantor of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One and is executing this Second Amendment to modify its terms.

persons.name: Jeffrey A. Schantz
persons.context: He is named in the original trust as a beneficiary, but his bequest is deleted by this amendment.

persons.name: Lauren J. Kwintner
persons.context: She notarized the execution of this Second Amendment by Jeffrey E. Epstein.

connections.description: Epstein was the grantor of a trust that originally included a financial bequest to Schantz, which was later removed.
Kwintner, as a Notary Public, officially witnessed and notarized Epstein's signature on the trust amendment.

events.title: Execution of Second Trust Amendment
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signs the Second Amendment to his 2001 Trust One, modifying its distribution terms.

events.title: First Trust Amendment
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein previously amended the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One.

keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein amended his 2001 Trust One in 2004 to delete a bequest to Jeffrey A. Schantz.
The amendment redirects $20 million to be distributed to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two'.
The document is notarized by Lauren J. Kwintner, a Notary Public for the State of New York.
This shows active management and significant restructuring of Epstein's financial trusts in the mid-2000s.
The original trust document dates to 2001, with a prior amendment in June 2003.
